I actually buckled down and did it... I joined a gym! Yup, a full year-long membership. I'm going to start going tomorrow! As part of the membership package, I get a free consultation with a personal trainer to help set up a fitness program. I think I'm going to go for a month or so, see what kind of results I'm getting, then meet with a trainer after that to help me create a program for myself. Very exciting. :) I also joined Weight Watchers online. The point tracking is so much fun! haha. Once I lose 10lbs I'm going to buy myself a nice new pair of runners. My goal is to lose 41lbs overall, so to make the goal seem more manageable I'm going to break it up into 10lb minigoals, with rewards at each level! 170 - new runners, 160 - manicure, 150 - facial and some nice makeup, 139 - new bathing suit (bikini perhaps? lol) and clothes! Ideally July 9 is my goal date. If I feel comfortable and confident with the way I look before 139 then I'm fine stopping at that point, but its nice to have a physical number to go by. I'm going to plan on going to the gym 5x a week with strength training sessions 2x a week. I'll try do 45 - 60 minutes of cardio per session (depending whether or not I'm doing strength training). I might even try attend a class or two. Pilates seems pretty appealing at the moment. 

Anyhow, just wanted to share my excitement. :)

I wonder what exactly it is that is keeping me from overcoming the obstacle of eating healthfully. Here is what I ate today:

Tim Horton's Iced Cappuccino (350 calories)
Tim Horton's chocolate chip cookie
salami sandwich (on whole wheat bread.. heh)
bowl of chicken soup (this was one of the better choices I made)
a box of Kraft Dinner (definitely not so good)

So.. overall.. I had no fruits or veggies, and basically ate a whole bunch of processed crap. Bad, very bad. I think the main reason is we have very little money, so we don't have a lot of fresh produce or healthy foods in the house. I'm going to have to try spend a little money on things that are good for me like fruit, veggies, whole grain breads and lean meats so I can attempt to pack a healthy lunch and prepare a nutritious dinner. On Thursday or Friday I'm going to head over to the gym I used to be a member of and purchase a membership. I don't care if it's expensive, because when I was a member I actually did go regularly. I just didn't have the money to renew that membership at the time. Regular exercise is something I'm going to have to incorporate into my life sooner rather than later.

I haven't posted here in ages. I haven't been losing weight, or exercising or eating right. Today everything is going to change! I'm eating a healthy breakfast, lunch, and dinner no matter what. I read an article n a magazine about how even though you may not be gaining weight on the outside in your 20s, you're putting fat around your organs and setting yourself up for future health problems. That really scared me! My goals for the next month are going to be: exercise for at least 30 minutes 4x a week, eat 1400 - 1500 calories per day, get in all my vitamins, and drink at least 2L of water. Lets see if I can do this for real this time. I'll keep everyone posted. ;)

height: 5'10"
weight: 171 (surprisngly! I'm usually 175.)
BMI: 24.5... in the normal weight range, but still at the higher end.

Goal:
139lbs by the beginning of April

that would mean a loss of 32lbs. If I were to reach a weight that I feel healthy and comfortable at before then, I would stop there.

A good friend of mine has just started the Weight Watchers program, and I'm going to start the South Beach Diet on Monday. Both of us are going to help motivate each other to get to our goals by July 1, then we'll reward ourselves with something fabulous, we're not sure what it will be yet. I think this is a great way to give me that extra kick in the butt to really keep pushing myself on this whole weight loss thing! I'm going to start going to the gym with my mom too, who is really looking forward to getting in shape. That will keep me motivated in that aspect of my life! These next few days will be hectic because I'm moving out of residence and going back home, so I won't have the opportunity to post for a little while. By the time I do, which is likely going to be Sunday, I'll be starting the SBD and aiming for 45 minutes of cardio 5x a week and strength training 3x. I'm going to post a weekly weigh-in on Monday's because that's going to be the official first day of this. I'll do an update on measurements every 2 weeks too, just for something fun that isn't my weight. haha. The goal is to go bathing suit shopping on July 1, so lets hope I'm looking decent by then!

Alright, I haven't been seeing any weight loss yet, so it is time for me to step things up a bit! I'm going to up my cardio sessions to 60 minutes each starting tomorrow. I'll do a 30 minute jog in the morning, then 30 minutes at the gym later in the day to break things up a bit. Once I get home (12 days) I'm going to start preparing meals for myself so I know everything that's going into them. I'm going to cut out sugar (excluding fruit), dairy, and all white stuff (white bread, white rice, pasta, poatoes) and replace it with smaller portions of high fibre foods. Here is what my first grocery trip will look like:

-apples
-pears
-oranges
-bananas
-berries
-spinach
-romaine lettuce
-cucumber
-tomato
-carrots
-hummus
-flax seed
-steel cut oats
-whole grain bread
-whole wheat pasta
-brown rice
-chicken breast 
-turkey breast lunchmeat
-salmon fillets
-tilapia
-canned tuna
-eggs
-soymilk

I'm going to start cutting back on sugar now, as well as dairy so I don't go into withdrawal when it's completely gone when I get home. lol. I've heard there is a new gym right by my house, so that will be super convenient for working out. No more 20 minute drives just to get there! Yay.

I'm back at school and all is well so far. I've joined a gym, and have been eating a lot healthier. My goal is to eat 3 small meals plus 2 snacks a day, and go to the gym 6 times a week. It will be an intense schedule with my classes, volunteering, and possibly a job if I can manage to snag one. I want to keep really busy this semester. Whenever I'm not studying in the library, I want to have something to do. I'm downloading some exercise videos (pilates, tae bo, and Carmen Electra's striptease!) so I can do those a few times a week too, just to spice things up. I've also been using www.fitday.com to keep track of what I'm eating and my activities. 

Aside from the healthy lifestyle I've been trying to live, nothing much is different here. I'm already behind in my readings, but that's because I still need to buy a few books! I will do that tomorrow, then get all caught up and hopefully stay that way for the rest of the year. 

I suppose I don't have much more to write about, so that's all for now. I'll try updating more often.
http://fashionista86.livejournal.com/4416.html

It is 4:38am and I have just finished 2 hours of reading for one of my classes. Oh my. I had a very, very strange day. I woke up at 11:30am, and decided to close my eyes for another half hour or so, only to wake up again at 8pm. I have no idea how I could have had such a long, uninterrupted sleep, but I managed. Now my sleep schedule is completely backwards. I also haven't eaten anything in over 24 hours, so I can't wait til the cafeteria is open at 7:30! I took a shower at 2, and from then on, tried to catch up on some reading. After I eat, I'm planning on going to the library til about 6, when I will meet my friends for dinner. I'll buy a muffin and yogurt to keep me going through the day. Hopefully I won't cave and leave the library sooner than I'm planning!

My break is almost up, so back to reading I shall go.

In the immortal words of Woody Allen, "I'm through with love!" I have finally decided after chasing the same guy for a bit more than a year that it is time to give up. He feigned interest for a bit, but that was the most I ever got out of this. I'm sure as soon as I stop trying to find love, it will come to me. That seems to be the way the universe works for the most part. I'm a touch sad about this revelation, because crushes are always fun, but this has gone from a crush to..hmm.. an annoyance I would say. Bah to that. 

A lot of studying needs to be done today, which is why I am up so bright and early! I need to shower, grab some breakfast, find a nice deserted place in the library and stay there for several hours. I think I will take another 30 minutes to relax before that shower.

There must be something terribly wrong with the world because I am updating for my third day in a row-YIKES!. haha.

Like I've said in my last few posts, I'm really stressed lately. Not even about school at this point, but money. Yep, that isn't exactly a nice feeling. I still owe about $1000 for this semester, plus $2240 for next semester and about $300 on my Visa. Uh oh. I don't know how I'm going to afford Christmas presents, going home for reading week in February, or going to those concerts in March. Hopefully I will be able to get a lot of shifts over Christmas break and make about $300 so at least I won't have to worry about the Visa. Then I'll have to keep a pretty steady job throughout the semester. Ack.

Sorry for the update on my financial troubles, but the only way I can stop thinking about it at night and actually get to sleep is if I write it down. Hopefully this will clear my mind for the next little while.

Updating two days in a row...This really is crazy for me. 

Things are starting to get really stressful, which is saying a lot because I am never stressed out about anything. I have an assignment due tomorrow and one on Thursday, neither of which I am looking forward to working on. I know it will be the greatest feeling ever when they are both finished and out of the way, but I am just so unbelievably lazy. I bombed two of my midterms (60% and 61%), so I'm not exactly feeling great about that. This assignment is worth 5% more than the midterm, so I'm going to try do really well on it and hopefully that will bring up my average. I will also have to study like crazy for the final. I want at least a 70% average. Last year I would have had an aneurysm with these marks, but now I'm not even sure how I feel. I know I deserve them because I barely studied or went to class, but still. It's a slap in the face. My parents will be so disappointed in my if they find out. Ack. I will have to keep this on the down-low.

What other aspects of my life need talking about? I am currently playing MSN games with "the boy." Oh joy, look what I have come to. In an attempt to increase his attraction to me, I have decided to keep him blocked for a week. What this will accomplish I'm not entirely sure. I don't honestly think it's a good idea...it's just a last attempt to scrounge up some feelings from him. I'm sure actually talking to him and getting to know him even better would probably make more sense in the long run, but I am clearly not being logical at this point. Stupid Hazel.

Tomorrow I will attempt to purchase Coldplay tickets, if I manage to get the presale password. Joy. Seeing one of my favourite bands two weeks before final exams in spring is sure to lift my spirits. 

I suppose that is all for now. It is late and I still need to shower and finish an assignment before bed.

I feel like I've abandoned this thing, so I'm going to make it my goal to update at least once a week. We'll see how that goes. 

I'm so busy lately! The workload in my classes is getting to be quite a bit. Christmas break is just around the corner and I'll finally be able to relax-thank GOD. 

Did I mention how excited I am for Christmas? lol. I got an e-mail from my mom the other day asking to e-mail her my wishlist.. You know how much I love wishlists! I'm asking for an iPod nano, the full series of Sex and the City on DVD (you can buy the set on Amazon), the first and second seasons of The OC, chunky necklaces, clothes (mom knows my style) and anything from Sephora. I know it seems like a lot, but I obviously won't get everything I ask for (especially since the first two items alone total $600+).

Hmm..Let's see what else is happening in my life. Not a whole lot, that's for sure. I'm not sure if the guy I like is into me. He still has a thing for his ex-girlfriend, so that complicates things. I can never seem to pick ones without any issues or attachments. *sigh* I'll chalk it up to bad luck or bad taste or something. heh. Sometimes when we're talking I feel like he is coming around, but I can never be too sure. No one has ever really liked me back before, which is a very very sad situation. Either he needs to come right out and tell me he likes me or I need to get over him immediately. There aren't exactly a ton of guys around here to be interested in, but I guess I just have to make do.

I suppose that's all for today. We'll see if I can keep this thing updated from now on! haha.

I went shopping at Gap today! Yay. I bought 3 things and it cost me $166. Ouch. They have a promotion going on where if you just try on a pair of jeans, you get $10 off any pair! So of course I bought a pair. :) I tried on a corduoroy blazer in American Eagle, but I didn't really like the way it fit so I didn't buy it. In Smart Set I tried on 2 gorgeous sweaters that I plan on going back to buy, a grey hook closure longsleeve shirt (which I'm also going back to buy), a jean jacket (you guessed it.. going back to buy it) and 2 black sweaters that were quite unflattering. I need to go back to the mall to try on a few things in AE and to find a pair of cargo pants. I can hardly wait. :D

Well, this looks like it's my first entry! I guess I'll give myself a bit of an introduction, then. :)

I absolutely -adore- fashion. It is my life. hehe. I just love shopping and putting together outfits. My style is definitely what you would call preppy. I'm an American Eagle, Gap, Abercrombie kinda gal. I'm just a girlie girl, but not a flake. hehe. 

I work at a movie theatre and I get free movies which is an awesome perk. My all-time favorite movie is a tie between Strictly Ballroom and Romeo + Juliet (the Baz Luhrmann version). As far as actors go, my favorites are Christian Slater, Ewan McGregor, Catherine Zeta-Jones and Christina Ricci. 

I'll throw in some other favorites for fun.
t.v. show - Queer as Folk, Six Feet Under, Curb Your Enthusiasm
book - Catcher in the Rye by J.D. Salinger, anything by Stephen Fry
food - linguine chicken tetrazzini from East Side Mario's, nachos with lots of jalapenos and guacamole, homemade baba ganouj and pita chips
drink - raspberry iced tea, cream soda, fresca, sparkling water
artist/group - pavement, the faint, hot hot heat, dandy warhols, bjork

Well, I suppose that's all for my introduction. :)
